Dialogue: No. I've got to get to a phone!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: We should hide!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: But, if Red tells Ted's guys my name, then they'll go to my apartment and find out about Angie!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: I think we should stay!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Why?!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Because I'm in the dumpster already! Shit! Fine!

Speaker: red
Dialogue: I just did, Matheson. Fuckin' Dale Denton's the other guys name. He was with Saul, they kicked my ass. What more do you want?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Ask if either of them were Asian.

Speaker: red
Dialogue: What? Um...white, they're both white. I think Denton might be a Jew, but I couldn't really tell.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Does he have something to do with our friend in there?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: If the Asians have the balls to send an assassin right into my home, we can't be too cautious. The boys say Denton and Saul are Caucasian. Maybe after their assassin failed, they hired this outside guy Denton to finish the job.  Also, the boys said that Saul mentioned "going to the casino."

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: But my parents live   in Canada. You don't think they're going   to go to Canada, do you? How would they   get a Canadian phone book even?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: All I know is Angie's new number is on my fridge and they could see that, so I have to get to her.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Dude, stay here. I'll be back in a minute.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Hells no! I don't want to be alone! I want to go with you!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Saul, just watch my back. I'll literally be five minutes. Please.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Fine. But hurry.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Angie!

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Who are these people? Why are they-

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I think their drug dealers.

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Well, it's complicated. See, the...uh...it doesn't matter right now, we just have to get out of here.

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Let's go to the police!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: No, they are the police!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: You... huff ...Angie? Dale! It's happening!

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: EEEHHHH!!!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: ARGGG!!!

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Dale, it's one of the drug dealers!!!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: No! I'm Dale's dealer, I'm S-

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Angie! Stop! It's Saul!

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Saul? Dale, who is-

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Dale, they're coming!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Why aren't we in that car?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Let's run, man! Run!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Huff   Huff  Where are we running?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Somewhere we can think.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: A fork?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: A bloody fork. In his girlfriends house. And the blood was fresh.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Maybe he killed her, to protect himself.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Or maybe it's the Asians fucking with us. What the fuck is going on!  Any luck with the cell phones?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: They smashed one and left the other one in the woods to distract us. Took us an hour to find it. And we found Denton's car, which was filled with all these strange disguises. These guys are for real.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: I want to talk to the Asians. Get me Cheung's number. Now.

Speaker: cheung
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Cheung. It's Ted.

Speaker: cheung
Dialogue: Record this conversation.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Cheung, I want you to call off your man Denton. I don't know what he is, a scout, assassin, and frankly I don't care. I just want him gone. I want him dead. If you do this, I'll consider it a peace offering, otherwise, you're asking for war. And just in case you forgot, I'm number one, and there's a reason for that. You've got 24 hours to reply.

Speaker: cheung
Dialogue: Ted Jones is slipping. Our assassin failed to kill him, but it did rattle his confidence. It's earlier than planned, but we should strike now, while he is confused. Let it be known-

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Victory joint complete. Here ya go.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: "Tell us what you know!" How fuckin' balls was that?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Like, really balls.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: And I think I fought pretty well, don't you? You know, for my first time. We were like Tango and Cash, man.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Or Scarface!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: BOOM! Knocked the door right off it's hinges!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: And you probably saved Angie, which is fucking pimp.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I probably couldn't have done it without you. Thanks, man. It is fucking pimp.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: We're in this together, right? So, ya know.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Thanks, man.  You know, my last dealer was a total dick. You're by far the coolest dealer I've ever had.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Wow. Thanks, man. I seriously appreciate that.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Yeah...like, the time before last time, I totally had weed. I just kind of wanted to chill with you.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Really? That's awesome, man. That means a lot to me, `cause, like, plenty of dudes come in to buy and pretend to be all buddy-buddy with me, but in my head I'm always, like, "you don't like me, you like my drugs, so fuck you, buddy!" You know? And just so you know, I totally could have lit that cross-joint on my own. I'd just have to use candles, but, like, I've never smoked one of those with anyone before.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: So, do you think we should leave town? We could just get on a bus and go, right?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: We only have, like, fifty bucks. I don't think that could even pay for one ticket.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What about your sack?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Oh man. It's still fucking killing me.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: No dude, your sack of weed. Can't we sell some?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Of course. That's my bread and butter. We just have to go to a highschool. It's the easiest market. Chester A. Arthur is like, a block a way.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: No way, man. I'm not going to sell to kids.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: We could go to Crackhead Park.

Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: It's a park. Really close, actually. Full of crackheads. They smoke weed too, though.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Yo. `sup. You guys want some chronic?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Man, this is great.

Speaker: ack
Dialogue: Cough   Cough  What's it called again?

Speaker: walt
Dialogue: Pineapple express. They said it, like, eight times, you fucking `tard.

Speaker: ack
Dialogue: Oh, so sorry if I-

Speaker: blake
Dialogue: Come on, man. Puff, puff, pass.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: You know, I went here for a year. Kicked me out for having a swiss army knife. Everyone has a swiss army knife!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I got like, thirty for my Bar Mitzvah.

Dialogue: My Bar Mitzvah sucked.

Speaker: ack
Dialogue: I touched Jessica Lubell's tit at your Bar Mitzvah.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: You touched a tit when you were twelve?

Speaker: walt
Dialogue: Lubell? Are you joking? Those are the finest tats in the grade!

Speaker: blake
Dialogue: A hundred and seventy eight.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Alright. You gimme all your money, you can each take two handfuls of weed. That treat ya right?

Speaker: desmond
Dialogue: That's fucking awesome!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: I know. Keep it on the down low.

Speaker: ack
Dialogue: Jason'll never believe this...until I show him all this weed!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: And we, my good man, are officially scott fuckin' free.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: There are still people trying to kill us.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: But at least now we can afford to run. I'm gonna go buy some celebration snacks. Let's have us a little mardi-gras fiesta.

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Don't move!

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Selling pot to my students isn't "decriminalized." I'm the liaison officer for this school and I just caught four students showing off handfuls of marijuana to their friends. They told me they got it back here. Put your hands up.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Wait! I wasn't selling anything! All I have is this little joint.

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: You call this little?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I don't even have any money! How did I sell weed if I don't have any money?!? I was just smoking it. I swear. Please.

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: It's possible you're telling the truth. I'm going to run a check and if it turns out you don't have any priors and all you've got is this small amount of marijuana, I'll let you go with a fine. Take a seat.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: They got Dale. Oh fuck, oh fuck, oh fuck...

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Denton.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What is this for? What did that thing tell you? What did I do?

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Hit and run, Mr. Denton. A double, actually. You hit two parked cars two nights ago.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: The lady cop. She's gonna kill him.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: You don't understand! You have to let me go! Dirty cops are gonna kill me! Please!

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Ted Jones?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Yeah. With grey-hair. Tell me you know what I'm talking about. He lives near Evergreen Heights. He-

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Are you telling me you saw Ted Jones and a police office shoot someone?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Yeah. An Asian someone.

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Stay calm, do as your told, I'll get you down to the station.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Yes ma'am.

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Oh my god! Is that blood? Oh my god!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: NO! What are you doing!?!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Saving you. Hold on, amigo. Tango and Cash!

Speaker: police liaison
Dialogue: Freeze mister! Don't even...

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: No! She was going to help us!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Oh...my balls...I seriously think I popped one...

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: IT'S HER! The lady cop!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Then who's that?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: The slurpee! I can't see!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Turn on the wipers!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Dude, I seriously can't see!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Kick out the window! Isn't that what they do?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: I don't know. Okay.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Get it out of there!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Ah! Ah! My leg!

Dialogue: She's following us! She's gaining on us!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Her car's better!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Do something!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Hold on. I've got an idea.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: WHAT THE FUCK WAS THAT?!?!?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Oh shit, man! I'm sorry! I thought she'd keep going.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Turn on the sirens!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Run!

Dialogue: Saul! Saul! I'm locked in!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: So... huff ... huff ...fuckin' sorry... huff ...forgot...

Dialogue: Don't touch me, you asshole!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: A thank you would be nice!

Dialogue: Could I have the, uh, Carlyle room, please?

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Dale?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Angie! Thank god you're okay!

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: I'm fine. How are you? Are you okay?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I'm great. I'm fine. I miss you. So, here's the plan, babe. I'm going to leave town and contact a government official or something. From somewhere safe. I know this shit is all fucked up and I just can't apologize enough.

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Dale. I've realized some problems and-

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I know there's a problem! That's the thing, that's why I-

Speaker: angie
Dialogue: Dale, shut up and listen. People are trying to kill you, and me! Dale, drug dealers are trying to kill me, because of you! It's fucking over, man. Are you kidding me? For gods sake...

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What? You're telling me you think I'm a dumb guy?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Are you joking? You're actually gonna smoke marijuana?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: How can you smoke marijuana after what we just went through? That clearly happened because we were smoking marijuana.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: No. It happened because those fucking kids didn't keep that shit on the down low. Which is weird, `cause they really seemed like cool kids.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: If you haven't noticed, we're not very functional when we're stoned, Saul.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: When I saved you with those Slurpees I was stoned. What do you gotta say to that? Maybe the pot is what gave me the creative capacity to come up with such a great plan! The Beatles were high!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: You didn't save me! She was going to protect us, and now we're wanted for all sorts of crazy shit!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: For one thing, I'm done dealing pot. Mostly, because I don't know where I would get it now, but still. And "b", fuck you, man. You can't judge me. We're exactly the same, and this whole thing's your fucking fault. You're the one who dropped the roach!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: It's not my fault!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Stop calling it marijuana!

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Guy drove like a mother-fucker. It was amazing.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: This is not good. We should have this under control. We haven't heard shit from the Asians. Got these lunatics after us. Shit.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: We should probably get to the farm.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Hey! Mrs. Mendelson!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Mrs. Corber! You gotta hide me!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Dale!?! What the fuck? Did you rat me out, you shitty bastard? That what happened?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: No! I came here to save you!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: To save me? Ha! That's rich! You're caught, too. And now I have to die with some asshole.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Saul, I deserved that, because I fucked you. You're right, this whole things my fault, and they only way I can make it up to you is by rescuing you, and that's why I'm here. To save my friend.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Tell ya what, Dale. You actually save me and I'll consider forgiving you for this mad shit.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Oh really? What, you forget to tell me you shoot lasers out of your eyes, or you got some kind of secret blowtorch strapped to your dick? We're not gonna escape, Dale, we're losers, and sinners, and after we die, we're gonna go to hell!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: We're not losers! We did that car chase. That was all you, man! You got away from the cops. I've watched, like, nine billion hours of worlds wildest police chases and I've never seen a guy get away. Not once! But you did it. You did the impossible.

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: You have them?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Where did you find them?

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: He shot Frank? Jesus. Fuckin' Frank.

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: Who the fuck is this Dale Denton?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: This isn't working. Turn around. I'm using my mouth.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Someone's coming!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Yo - if I cough, I'm going to make a move, if I cough twice, you take the lead. Got it?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: What? No! What if you actually cough?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Holy shit, man! I'm sorry!

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Has anyone seen my bigger knife?  Do you guys hear that?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Dale? You're alive!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: They got your ear.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: My what?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Here. Get up.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: AAHHHH!!! MY EAR!!!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Well, you kneed my balls!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: You shot him?

Speaker: carol
Dialogue: On three.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Look at all this fucking weed, man. Where the hell are we? Is this some underground weed city we don't know about?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I don't know! That guy just blew half my fucking ear off!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: There's some dudes in here. I saw them when I got dragged down. And there's some kind of super-suit or something.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: You could boost me up! We'll sneak out.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Wha-

Speaker: ted
Dialogue: Denton!!!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: AHHH!!!

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Fuck...

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Sorry, Ted...

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Cough   Cough  What the fuck happened?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: We... Cough ...we did it. We beat them. We won.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: No fucking way. Seriously?  How did that happen?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I have absolutely no idea.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: They were fighting Asian dudes, man.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Asian dudes? So, okay...maybe this is revenge for that Asian dude I saw Ted kill.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I've gotta get downtown, try and win Angie back.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Tell her you cut off your ear for her, like that crazy artist.  But, seriously dude, your joking right? She'll never take you back, ever. Just grow up and date a woman your own age.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Do you think we should have looked for the ear? They probably could've re- attached it, eh? I mean, this ear thing kind of fucking sucks.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Don't worry, man. Look at Evander Holyfield, he looks totally normal. And plus, I saw this thing on the Discovery Channel, they can actually grow ears, like, in a petri dish, or even on the side of a mouse. And you only need half of one. It'll be a fuckin' cinch.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I just realized I've 100% lost my job by now. I haven't called in for days.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Who fuckin' cares? I thought you wanted to be a talk radio dude anyways? And, like, I never said anything, but you do have the voice. Like, when I didn't know what you did, I kind of thought you might have been doing cartoon voices, you know, like that Shrek shit, and that's why you wore a suit.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Do you hear something?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: All I hear is ringing.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Dude, I'm kind of freakin' out. Like...I don't know...like, there might be someone out there. I mean...how do we know we got them all?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: Well...the barn did collapse in a ball of fire, and we probably each inhaled about ten pounds of weed smoke, so...it's just, you know-

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What-

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Sshh! Can you hear that?

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Just listen.

Speaker: dale
Dialogue: I literally only hear ringing.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Wait! Me too!
